intro: Macroscepis elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved macrocephalum, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
